meanings.definition: The fused head and thorax of arachnids and some crustaceans.
meanings.sent1: The cephalthorax of the spider helps it to sense its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The cephalthorax of the crab is where its eyes and mouth are located.
meanings.sent3: The cephalthorax of the scorpion looked like a tiny helmet.
meanings.sent4: The cephalthorax of the lobster acts as a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The cephalthorax of the horseshoe crab is a unique feature of its anatomy.

meanings.definition: The front part of the body in certain insects, consisting of the head and thorax combined.
meanings.sent1: The cephalthorax of the bee contains its sensory organs.
meanings.sent2: The cephalthorax of the ant is where its powerful jaws are located.
meanings.sent3: The cephalthorax of the beetle looked like a tiny helmet.
meanings.sent4: The cephalthorax of the grasshopper is like a protective shield for its vital organs.
meanings.sent5: The cephalthorax of the butterfly is beautifully colored and patterned.
